name: tap water production, direct filtration treatment | tap water | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/11797/documentation

This dataset represents production of 1 kg of tap water under pressure at facility gate, ready for distribution in network. It represents average operation of direct filtration treatment for production of tap water. Direct filtration treatment includes sand filtration and disinfection. Inventory was constructed from reported chemicals, energy inputs and wastes from 2 distinct direct filtration plants located in Québec covering nearly 100% of total production of tap water from this technology.

From the intake pumping of raw surface water into the water treatment plant. 

This dataset ends with the production of tap water, at facility gate, under pressure. It includes energy for intake pumping, treatment system, lighting and heating of the building as well as the energy of the pump pressurizing water to the beginning of the network. It includes all chemicals and material added to the water during treatment and, when needed, ultraviolent lamps for replacement. It excludes energy for pumping stations and water losses within the network which is included in the tap water market. Emissions to the environment occurring during the treatment and during the distribution were not considered as they are assumed negligible. Main substance in water that would be released in the environment are assumed to be considered in wastewater processes.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/36:Water collection, treatment and supply/360:Water collection, treatment and supply/3600:Water collection, treatment and supply

processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: No extrapolation. The two direct filtration treatment tap water production facilities represents near 100% of direct filtration treatment facility in Québec. Direct filtration treatment represents 41.6% of all tap water volume produced in Quebec.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Based on data collected from selected plants chosen either for their technological specificities or their production representativeness. A survey campaign was conducted in summer 2013 with 2012 as a reference year. All technologies combined, 16 distinct tap water production plants participated.
